dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong
News Content: Heading into 2023, Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) had a substantial investment in General Motors(NYSE: GM). According to Berkshire's SEC filings, the conglomerate owned 50 million shares of GM at the beginning of that year, worth about $1.7 billion at the time.

Throughout 2023, Buffett unloaded all of Berkshire's General Motors stock. However, I think he made the wrong decision. Not only is General Motors up by more than 55% since the end of the quarter when Berkshire sold, but the company is also doing a great job of maximizing profits and creating shareholder value.

Lots to like about this "legacy" automaker

Even though Buffett sold GM, there's quite a bit to like about the stock right now.

For one thing, the business has been surprisingly resilient, given the combination of higher interest rates and more cautious consumer spending. In the company's third-quarter 2024 earnings, the latest reported, GM surprised investors with both top- and bottom-line results that handily surpassed expectations, as well as an increase in its full-year earnings guidance.

Then, at its October 2024 investor day, management surprised the market, which expected a slowdown, by saying that its 2025 adjusted earnings will be in a "similar range" to 2024.

Other recent news has been quite encouraging as well. GM reported that its 2024 sales increased by 4% and that its market share increased overall and doubled in the case of electric vehicles. Deliveries in China increased by 40.6% sequentially in the fourth quarter.

Another recent development is that GM will pivot its Cruise autonomous strategy away from developing robotaxis and toward developing its Super Cruise autonomous technology for personal vehicles. This move alone is expected to save the company more than $1 billion annually.

GM is also aggressively using excess capital to buy back shares. Since late 2023, when GM announced an accelerated buyback program, the company's outstanding share count has declined by 21%, and there could be more buybacks ahead, especially considering the stronger-than-expected 2025 outlook and the fact that it hopefully won't be sinking as much money into automation. It's also worth noting that since the buyback was announced, GM's stock is up by more than 40%.

It's not too surprising that GM is being so aggressive with buybacks. The stock trades for just 5.5 times trailing-12-month earnings and 5.1 times forward earnings. If GM can achieve its 2025 targets and execute well on its growth plans, the stock could be a tremendous bargain.

Story Continues

Why did Buffett sell?

Buffett hasn't specified his reasons for selling General Motors. But it's worth noting that he has been a net seller of stocks for the past couple of years and has aggressively reduced some of Berkshire's largest investments, including the massive stakes in Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) and Bank of America(NYSE: BAC).

My instinct is that he sold because of some of the perceived risk factors with the stock. At the time of the sales, many experts were forecasting new auto demand to fall more than it actually did, and in the fall of 2023, there was a strike by auto workers that cost GM an estimated $800 million.

Whatever the reasons Buffett had for selling might be, I think he's wrong, and I don't often say that about Buffett's moves. GM is doing a fantastic job of keeping its sales and profit high, and I think this could be one of the biggest bargains in the stock market right now.

Should you invest $1,000 in General Motors right now?

Before you buy stock in General Motors, consider this:

The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now… and General Motors wasn’t one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Consider when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you’d have $843,960!*

Stock Advisor provides investors with an easy-to-follow blueprint for success, including guidance on building a portfolio, regular updates from analysts, and two new stock picks each month. TheStock Advisorservice has more than quadrupled the return of S&P 500 since 2002*.

See the 10 stocks »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025

Bank of America is an advertising partner of Motley Fool Money. Matt Frankel has positions in Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, and General Motors. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool recommends General Motors and recommends the following options: long January 2025 $25 calls on General Motors. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The headline poses a question about Apple's status as a market leader, which may indicate uncertainty among investors. If the market perceives that Apple is losing its competitive edge, it could lead to a decline in stock price. However, Apple's strong brand loyalty and historical performance may mitigate this risk. Overall, the lack of definitive positive news suggests a higher probability of a price decline compared to a rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news is predominantly negative for Apple. Nvidia surpassing Apple in market capitalization is a symbolic blow. More importantly, the Jefferies downgrade to "Underperform" citing weak iPhone 17/18 sales expectations and concerns about iPhone SE 4 demand are significant negative catalysts. The reported decline in iPhone shipments and weak sales in China further reinforce the bearish outlook. While Apple Intelligence is mentioned, the analysts' skepticism about its immediate impact and the comparison to used iPhone 13 models suggest it's not seen as a strong driver of sales. Therefore, the negative factors outweigh any potential positives.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The provided news article focuses on Deutsche Bank raising its price target for Barclays (BCS), not Apple (AAPL).  While the article mentions Apple in relation to Barclays potentially taking over its credit card partnership with Goldman Sachs, this is indirect and doesn't provide a direct impact assessment on Apple's stock price.  Therefore, the news is largely irrelevant to predicting Apple's stock price movement. Any price movement in AAPL would be due to other market factors and not this specific news.  We assume a neutral probability distribution based on the lack of relevant information.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights a downgrade in Apple's stock rating by Jefferies and Loop Capital, citing concerns about weak iPhone sales and reduced demand ahead of the iPhone 17. Additionally, the stock has already experienced a significant drop (4.1% in the morning session and 3.2% by close) due to this news and previous concerns about declining market share in China. The market's reaction suggests that the news is meaningful but not fundamentally altering the perception of Apple's business. Given the negative sentiment and the recent downward trend in Apple's stock price, the probability of further decline is higher than a rise in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The provided news article discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock, which is not directly related to Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, the article mentions that Buffett has been a net seller of stocks, including a massive stake in Apple. The article's positive outlook on GM does not directly impact AAPL's stock price. Given that the news does not provide specific information about Apple, the probabilities of AAPL's stock price rising or falling due to this news are relatively low. The overall market sentiment and other factors not mentioned in the article will likely have a more significant impact on AAPL's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses Meta's plans to release new wearable devices, including smart glasses, watches, and earbuds, which could potentially compete with Apple's products. However, the article does not provide any direct negative information about Apple or its products. Instead, it highlights Meta's efforts to expand its product line and compete in the market. As a result, the news may have a slight negative impact on Apple's stock price due to increased competition, but the effect is likely to be minimal. Therefore, the probability of the stock price rising is slightly lower than the probability of the stock price falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The provided news article discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock, expressing a positive outlook on GM's future performance. However, the article does not provide any direct information about Apple Inc. (AAPL). The only relevant connection is that Buffett has also been a net seller of stocks, including a massive stake in Apple. Given that the news does not provide specific information about Apple, the probabilities of AAPL's stock price rising or falling due to this news are relatively low. The overall market sentiment and other factors not mentioned in the article will likely have a more significant impact on AAPL's stock price. Therefore, a neutral prediction is reasonable.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.5,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.5
}
```
